ref: Conf: Nuclear Data For Reactors Conf., Paris 1966, Vol.2, p.3 (1966)
title: -The Ratio of Thermal Neutron Capture To Fission for U-235 -.

x4codes.hlp: Atomic Energy Research Establishment (AERE), Harwell, United Kingdom

x4freetext: CHEMISTRY DIVISION.

x4codes.shortRef: Conf: Nuclear Data For Reactors Conf., Paris 1966, Vol.2, p.3 (1966)

x4freetext: MAIN REFERENCE,FINAL DATA GIVEN.

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Journal of Inorganic and Nuclear Chemistry, Vol.24, p.1493 (1962)

x4freetext: DATA SUPERSEDED.
-THE RATIO OF THERMAL NEUTRON CAPTURE TO FISSION FOR
MASS SPECTROMETER.
PLUTO REACTOR.
IRRADIATION IN THE FLUX SCANNING TUBE OF THE
B2 FUEL ELEMENT OF THE PLUTO REACTOR FOR 47 DAYS.
.THE NEUTRON SPECTRUM IN PLUTO HAS A TEMPERATURE OF
106 DEGREES AND A LARGE EPITHERMAL COMPONENT RANGING
FROM 0.046 TO 0.066 FOR THE EPITHERMAL INDEX.
.SAMPLE WERE PREPARED BY MIXING 93 PERCENT ENRICHED
U-235 WITH 99.995 PERCENT ENRICHED U-238. ALIQUOTS
OF APPROX 100 MICRO-GM U-235 WERE DISPERSED IN ABOUT
10 MG MAGNESIUM OXIDE FOR IRRADIATION.

x4codes.hlp: Off-line mass separation of a product

x4freetext: ISOTOPIC MASS SEPERATION USING AN A.E.I.
TYPE M.S.5 MASS SPECTROMETER. 10 MICRO-G URANIUM
ON TUNGSTEN FILAMENT SURFACE IONISATION SOURCE.
.ALPHA DERIVED FROM CHANGES IN ISOTOPIC COMPOSITION
OF URANIUM MIXTURES FROM NEUTRON CAPTURE
AND FISSION.
2200 M/SEC VALUE.
SEPERATE CO-59, SM-149 AND U-238 SAMPLE
MONITORS WERE USED TO DETERMINE NEUTRON FLUX, THE
SPECTRUM TEMPERATURE AND THE EPITHERMAL COMPONENT.
.UNCERTAINTY IN THE DERIVED 2200 M/SEC VALUE ARE
FROM MASS SPECTROMETER STATISTICAL ERRORS (0.1 PC),
DETERMINATION OF SPECTRUM AVERAGE ALPHA (1.0 PC),
THIS IS THEN COMBINED WITH UNCERTAINTIES IN WESTCOTTS
G AND S FACTORS TO GIVE A TOTAL ABSOLUTE UNCERATAINTY
.FINAL DATA FROM PAGE 12, 66PARIS.
DATE and reference code corrected
